question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Be sure to provide executable code for demonstration whenever possible. Help me create an HTML code with the theme of Minecraft.

checklist.title: Is the Minecraft visual style accurately reproduced?
checklist.description: Review whether the HTML/CSS implementation accurately captures the distinctive blocky, pixelated aesthetic of Minecraft. Score 0 if there's no visual resemblance to Minecraft, 5 if basic blocky elements are present but lack authenticity, and 10 if the implementation convincingly recreates the game's iconic visual style including textures, colors, and proportions.

checklist.title: Are Minecraft-specific elements included?
checklist.description: Evaluate the presence of recognizable Minecraft elements such as blocks (dirt, stone, wood), characters (Steve, creepers, endermen), items (pickaxe, sword), or environments (biomes). Score 3 points for each category of elements properly implemented (blocks, characters, items, environments) with a maximum of 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there any interactive functionality that reflects Minecraft gameplay?
checklist.description: Check whether the implementation includes interactive elements like block placement/breaking, character movement, crafting mechanics, or day/night cycles. Award 3 points for each interactive Minecraft-like feature that works properly, with basic interaction receiving 5 points and complex gameplay mechanics earning the full 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Minecraft audio experience incorporated?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements Minecraft-style sound effects (block breaking sounds, background music, mob noises) or music that enhances the Minecraft theme. Score 0 if no audio is included, 5 if basic sound effects are implemented, and 10 if there's a comprehensive audio experience that authentically reproduces the Minecraft soundscape.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as window resizing, different screen sizes, browser compatibility issues) and provide appropriate fallbacks. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Procedural terrain generation 2. Weather effects 3. Mob AI simulation). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple ways to render the same block type) 2. Function modules unrelated to Minecraft (e.g., non-thematic elements) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle systems). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core Minecraft theme is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating rendering logic from game mechanics), code organization, and performance optimization. Deduct 5 points if global variable pollution is found; deduct 5 points if the code is not organized into logical components; deduct 5 points if there are significant performance issues. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles while maintaining Minecraft aesthetics: 1) Faithful color palette matching the game 2) Proper layout spacing for UI elements 3) Consistent pixelated styling. Deduct 3 points for each inconsistently styled element, 5 points for colors that don't match Minecraft's palette, and 5 points for mixing pixel art with high-resolution elements. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether any animations or transitions feel appropriate to Minecraft: 1) Block breaking/placement animations 2) Character movement fluidity 3) UI responsiveness. Deduct 5 points for each choppy animation, 3 points for inconsistent movement speed, and 5 points for laggy interactions. The full score is 10 points.
